title: Schapelle Corby hints she will appear on The Masked Singer
text:
Convicted drug trafficker Schapelle Corby says she is open to the idea of being a contestant on Channel 10 ratings smash The Masked Singer.

On Wednesday, Schapelle gave her first radio interview since being deported from Bali in 2017, where she had served three years on parole and almost a decade behind bars for trying to smuggle marijuana into Indonesia.

Speaking on The Kyle and Jackie O Show, the 42-year-old was asked about rumours she will soon be appearing on reality television.

'Never say never!' Schapelle Corby (left) hinted at a possible appearance on The Masked Singer during an interview with The Kyle and Jackie O Show on Wednesday

'Never say never!' she said, after radio host Jackie 'O' Henderson asked if she would ever consider a show like The Bachelorette or Big Brother.

Co-host Kyle Sandilands added: 'You know what I'd like to see you in? Maybe you could go in I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here?'

'I'm vegetarian, I can't eat spiders,' Schapelle replied. 'I can eat roots and leaves.'

She's a fan! Schapelle said she watched the Korean version of The Masked Singer while on parole in Bali and 'loved the show'. Pictured: Osher Günsberg (left) and Cody Simpson (right)

Jackie, who is a judge on The Masked Singer, then suggested: 'Can you sing? Would you ever go on The Masked Singer? Because someone guessed you!'

Schapelle responded: 'When I was on parole, I used to watch the Korean [version of] The Masked Singer, so I was so excited, I loved that show.

'But I don't know any Australian celebrities... so I would be like Lindsay Lohan [who was accused of not recognising the contestants]. I mean, I look like her too!'

Singing chops: Schapelle (pictured with her sister, Mercedes, at Gold Coast Airport on Tuesday), released an electro-pop single, Palm Trees ft. Nat Z, early last year

When Jackie asked if Schapelle would be interested in performing on The Masked Singer, she began singing her 2018 viral hit single, Palm Trees ft. Nat Z.

'Nah, that's no good!' Kyle interrupted, clearly not impressed by her vocal talents.

Schapelle also confirmed she had previously turned down an offer from Channel 10 to be the Bachelorette because she already has a boyfriend.

She has been in a long-term relationship with Ben Panangian, a fellow drug criminal whom she met at a church service in Kerobokan Prison, since 2006.

She's taken! Schapelle also confirmed to KIIS FM that she had previously turned down an offer to be the Bachelorette, as she is already dating Ben Panangian (pictured), whom she met in Kerobokan Prison in 2006

Schapelle became a household name after she was arrested in October 2004 at Bali's Ngurah Rai Airport with 4.1kg of marijuana wrapped in plastic inside her boogie board bag.

She was later sentenced to 20 years in prison, but after a series of sentence reductions was released on parole in February 2014 after nine years behind bars.

In May 2017, she was deported back to Australia amid a media frenzy.
description: Convicted drug trafficker Schapelle Corby says she is open to the idea of being a contestant on Channel 10 ratings smash The Masked Singer.
authors: Jo Scrimshire For Daily Mail Australia
